The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and capturing the crew immediately, saving themselves. Unfortunately the search party are also under attack by the kidnapper and now must fight to survive.
It starts off a bit slow and to be frank boring. There is nothing really ground breaking here

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent world. In the episode, titled MEAN SOCCER WEEK, Calamity Cat pursues his funny-looking sweetheart, Miss Hourglass. Calamity and his amiable wildcat chum, Calico cut up quite a bit of mischief until a soccer ball finds its way

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to My Life Is Murder by the same director and A date for mad Mary by the same editor :/) Characters do not grow, everyone is monochromatic, you cannot get attached enough to anyone to enjoy the story with them. The shooting and the sound design is amateurish too.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Hunting Worlds. STOCKSY and friends dish out stock photography. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three starring the martial artist character played by Holmes as an effort to capitalize on the popularity of his role in Best of the Best.
